Coverage decreased (-0.06%) to 70.831% when pulling **3860d8d9b3f0ed003a6968ed77e9768d8560a6c4 on jkff:textio-read-all** into **95e6bbe5065a983f9c71b79b20df1fda83c9fd1b on apache:master**.

In truth, I'm not opposed to a mechanism _like_ `PipelineOptions` to provide global settings during pipeline construction, but that won't actually solve the problem. The underlying issue is that templates already can't control expansions of transforms (I may be out of date) because the full pipeline is constructed prior to dynamic options being provided.

We got into trouble using `PipelineOptions` to control expansion because of the abstraction perforation inherent in `PipelineOptions.as(...)`: transforms could observe runner options and vice versa and each could alter their behavior in non-portable ways. I'm belaboring this in part to remind myself of why we cannot reintroduce it as-is. @lukecwik - can `PipelineOptions` support package private options? Other ideas? But I digress - this still won't let a template control expansion.

Thank you so much for your feedback, You asked about removing OnceTriggerStateMachine, is there a specific reason I mean I can surely do that but I am hoping to understand more about the logic behind. Are we getting read of the OnceTrigger Semantic or is it already very well captured by the TriggerStateMachine implementation?

[![Coverage Status](https://:/builds/12144636/badge)](https://:/builds/12144636)

Coverage increased (+0.007%) to 70.896% when pulling **556d291bc3154695450ac18076c82cccc790ecb7 on vikkyrk:fn_api_runner_test** into **95e6bbe5065a983f9c71b79b20df1fda83c9fd1b on apache:master**.

You have asked some very good questions about triggers.

First let me answer the question for this PR: The `TriggerStateMachine` is just a helper for a runner to implement triggers. It is not part of the definition of a trigger for a user. So `OnceTrigger` and `Trigger` exist in the SDK when you are building a pipeline, and the SDK handles validation there. When that pipeline arrives for execution, you don't have to keep track of it.

Separate from that, I do believe that we should eliminate the `OnceTrigger` conceptually, since it is a risk of data loss. But that work is somewhat more complex now because of backwards compatibility concerns. It is not part of this JIRA issue.
Not obsolete at all. This is important work that just didn't quite make it to top priority.
Thank you for your answers, it makes more sense to me now will remove  ```OnceTriggerStateMachine ``` implementation.

[![Coverage Status](https://:/builds/12144884/badge)](https://:/builds/12144884)

Coverage decreased (-0.2%) to 70.721% when pulling **1eeb208816679213d537bd272b7a5a9cb8abe591 on jkff:textio-read-all** into **95e6bbe5065a983f9c71b79b20df1fda83c9fd1b on apache:master**.

@kennknowles I may be misunderstanding, but I think the specific case I'm
referring to (branching on what source implementation to use) would have
solved the problem because the selection of "I am creating a template" (and
a corresponding flip on a BQ-specific toggle) is available at construction
time.  The specific parameters to the source (e.g. table) would be dynamic
and inaccessible, but that's orthogonal.

I'm rusty on the I/O substitution stuff we have around for native sources,
but maybe there's a hook there I could use?

On Mon, Jun 26, 2017 at 8:21 PM, Lukasz Cwik <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @kennknowles <https://github.com/kennknowles> No, from javadoc
> <https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/reflect/Proxy.html#getProxyClass(java.lang.ClassLoader,%20java.lang.Class...)>:
> "All non-public interfaces must be in the same package; otherwise, it would
> not be possible for the proxy class to implement all of the interfaces,
> regardless of what package it is defined in."
>
> We might be able to do something with ByteBuddy or ASM to remove this
> limitation but a significant rewrite of PipelineOptionsFactory/ProxyIn
> vocationHandler would be required.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/2123#issuecomment-311241895>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ACQVgX_HxL7uWnFTJythZ6yyHMo34MZHks5sIHU4gaJpZM4MN3rQ>
> .
>

@sammcveety OK, I thought you wanted the template instantiator to control this. In that case, the problem is the one I mused upon. I don't have a ready solution that let's `BigQueryIO` own the decision. A runner has access to options and could do a substitution, if that is what you are alluding to, but it would be owned by the runner.

CC: @jbonofre

I'm maybe not the best reviewer for this PR but interested by this change ;)

It appears the root configuration corrupts child configurations if they switch from blacklist to whitelist. There have been some fixes to our snappy dependency that should make this go right through once I fix that.

R: @lukecwik
LGTM, thanks.

`BeamSqlRow` seems a good option to me to store the intermediate data of UDAF, as 1) it's self-described with variable data type, 2) can keep multiple data elements like `AVG`, and 3) no need to write customized coder. I would consider it as a sub-row in aggregator, may need some JavaDoc to explain a bit.

Other suggestion?
Redundant with #3445.

Seems like AmqpIOTest sometimes hangs on my machine, hanging `mvn clean verify`:

...
Jun 27, 2017 7:16:08 PM org.apache.beam.sdk.io.amqp.AmqpIOTest$2 run
INFO: Received: AmqpValue{Test 93}
Jun 27, 2017 7:16:08 PM org.apache.beam.sdk.io.amqp.AmqpIOTest$2 run
INFO: Received: AmqpValue{Test 94}
Jun 27, 2017 7:16:08 PM org.apache.beam.sdk.io.amqp.AmqpIOTest$2 run
INFO: Received: AmqpValue{Test 95}
Jun 27, 2017 7:16:08 PM org.apache.beam.sdk.io.amqp.AmqpIOTest findFreeNetworkPort
INFO: Finding free network port
Jun 27, 2017 7:16:10 PM org.apache.qpid.proton.messenger.impl.MessengerImpl processAllConnectors
SEVERE: Error processing connection
java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused
        at sun.nio.ch.SocketChannelImpl.checkConnect(Native Method)
        at sun.nio.ch.SocketChannelImpl.finishConnect(SocketChannelImpl.java:717)
        at org.apache.qpid.proton.driver.impl.ConnectorImpl.process(ConnectorImpl.java:89)
        at org.apache.qpid.proton.messenger.impl.MessengerImpl.processAllConnectors(MessengerImpl.java:687)
        at org.apache.qpid.proton.messenger.impl.MessengerImpl.waitUntil(MessengerImpl.java:863)
        at org.apache.qpid.proton.messenger.impl.MessengerImpl.waitUntil(MessengerImpl.java:844)
        at org.apache.qpid.proton.messenger.impl.MessengerImpl.send(MessengerImpl.java:417)
        at org.apache.qpid.proton.messenger.impl.MessengerImpl.send(MessengerImpl.java:394)
        at org.apache.beam.sdk.io.amqp.AmqpIOTest$1.run(AmqpIOTest.java:82)

Would you mind rolling this back / disabling the test, investigating the failure, and rolling forward?

No need to write customized `Coder` is a strong point for exposing `BeamSqlRow`, it will simplify the implementation for UDF developer, just in exchange they need to know what a `BeamSqlRow` is, I'm ok to do it this way.

you mean `kafka-clients`, right? Seems it is actually needed. Our pom has configured the maven dependency plugin to check whether there are unused dependencies, and whether there are dependencies which are used but not declared, so if the code can build, the dependencies should be correct, we seems not need to review the pom manually?

Can you explain this more? It is a very unusual thing to hardcode a dependency that we don't actually have.
Make sense, let's keep it.
Thanks @takidau.
Let me disable the test for now. Does it occur only on your machine (I didn't see that on Jenkins) ?
Tests are failing. Could you look at that?
It occurs pretty reliably on my machine with `mvn clean verify -Prelease -T 1C -fae -pl '!sdks/python'` (the command I usually use to test changes before merging)
OK, thanks, I'm disabling the tests and investigate.
Hmmm, I don't reproduce on my machine. Let me investigate deeper.
Thanks Kenn!
